contentrichtext.text: {{refimprove|date=December 2010}} [[Image:Ophelia (Pierre Auguste Cot).jpg|thumb|right|''[[Ophelia (character)|Ophelia]],'' 1870]] '''Pierre Auguste Cot''' (17 February 1837 – 2 August 1883) was a [[France|French]] painter of the [[Academic Classicism]] school. ==Life and career== Cot was born in [[Bédarieux]], [[Hérault]], and initially studied at l'Ecole des Beaux-Arts in [[Toulouse]] before going to Paris. He studied under [[Leon Cogniet]], [[Alexandre Cabanel]] and [[William-Adolphe Bouguereau]]. In 1863 he made a successful debut at the [[Salon (Paris)|Salon]], and from the 1870s, his popularity grew quickly. [[File:Gabrielle Cot 1890.jpg|thumb|upright|left|Bouguereau's ''Gabrielle Cot'' (1890), a portrait of Cot's daughter]] Cot enjoyed the patronage of the academic sculptor [[Francisque Joseph Duret|Francisque Duret]], whose daughter he married, and of Bouguereau, with whom he had also worked. Bouguereau painted a portrait of Cot's daughter, Gabrielle. Bouguereau had dined with the Cot family to celebrate Gabrielle's marriage to an architect named Zilin. The artist made a gift of the painting to the wife of Duret, Gabrielle's grandmother.<ref>[[Sotheby's]] catalogue [http://www.sothebys.com/en/catalogues/ecatalogue.html/2011/19th-century-european-art-n08783#/r=/en/ecat.fhtml.N08783.html+r.m=/en/ecat.lot.N08783.html/43/+r.o=/en/ecat.notes.N08783.html/43/ notes and provenance.] The portrait has been known variously as ''Tête de jeune fille'' ("Head of a Young Girl"), ''Portrait of Gabrielle Drienza'', ''Portrait de Madame Z'', and ''Head of [Mme] Ailin, Gabrielle Cot''.</ref> Cot won various prizes and medals, and in 1874 was made Chevalier of the [[Légion d'Honneur|Legion of Honour]]. ==Works== He created several works of lasting popularity, including ''Le Printemps'', featuring two young lovers sitting upon a swing, and ''[[The Storm (painting)|The Storm]].'' Both these paintings are on display at the [[Metropolitan Museum of Art]] in [[New York City]]; ''The Storm'' belongs to the museum while ''Le Printemps'' is owned privately. Cot also was renowned for his [[portrait]]s, which made up the majority of his work. The more enduring figurative work, such as ''[[The Storm (painting)|The Storm]],'' is comparatively rare. Shortly after his death at the age of forty-six (2 August 1883), a subscription was undertaken for a commemorative monument to the artist, which was erected at Bédarieux in 1892. ===Selected works=== [[Image:PIERRE-AUGUSTE COT - Primavera (Museo Metropolitano de Nueva York, 1873. Óleo sobre lienzo, 213.4 x 127 cm).jpg|upright|thumb|''Spring,'' 1873 ([[Metropolitan Museum of Art]], [[New York City]])]] * ''[[Dionysia]]'' (1870), [[Chi-Mei Museum]], [[Taiwan]] * ''[[Ophelia]]'' (1870) * ''The Gypsy'' or ''La Bohémienne'' (1871) * ''Spring'' or ''Le Printemps'' (1873), [[Metropolitan Museum of Art]], [[New York City]] * ''[[The Storm (painting)|The Storm]]'' or ''La Tempête'' (1880), Metropolitan Museum of Art<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.metmuseum.org/toah/hd/sara/ho_87.15.134.htm |title=Metropolitan Museum of Art - Pierre-Auguste Cot: The Storm (87.15.134) |publisher=Metmuseum.org |date=2012-07-27 |accessdate=2012-08-18}}</ref> * ''The Reading Light'' or ''La Liseuse'' (about 1880) * ''Portrait of Madame Mas'' (1882) * ''Mireille'' (1882), [[Musée Fabre]], [[Montpellier]] * ''Charity for My Sister'', [[Wolverhampton Art Gallery]] ==Students== *[[Ellen Day Hale]] (1855–1940) *[[Anna Elizabeth Klumpke]] (1856–1942) ==Notes== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Commonscat-inline|Pierre Auguste Cot}} {{Authority control|VIAF=42113851}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Cot, Pierre Auguste | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = French painter | DATE OF BIRTH = 17 February 1837 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 2 August 1883 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Cot, Pierre Auguste}} [[Category:1837 births]] [[Category:1883 deaths]] [[Category:People from Bédarieux]] [[Category:19th-century French painters]] [[Category:Academic art]] [[Category:Chevaliers of the Légion d'honneur]]
